metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 80兆円規模の対米投資“第1弾を選定”トランプ大統領が発表
all.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、17日、SNSへの投稿で、先の日米合意に基づく日本からアメリカへの80兆円規模の投資や融資などをめぐって、石油・ガス事業や重要鉱物事業など3つのプロジェクトを第1弾に選定したと発表しました。

all.headline: スピードスケート女子パシュート 日本が銅 3大会連続のメダル
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スピードスケートの女子団体パシュートは3位決定戦が行われ、日本はアメリカに勝ち銅メダルを獲得しました。日本はこの種目3大会連続のメダル獲得となりました。また今大会で日本が獲得したメダルが合わせて19個となり、過去最多の前回・北京大会を上回りました。

all.headline: フィギュア女子SP 初出場・中井亜美がトップ 坂本花織は2位
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートは女子シングル前半のショートプログラムが行われ、初出場の17歳・中井亜美選手が冒頭に大技の「トリプルアクセル」を成功させて自己ベストの78.71をマークしトップに立ちました。またエースの坂本花織選手が77.23で2位で続き、初出場の千葉百音選手が74.00で4位となっています。

all.headline: 特別国会きょう召集 今夜 第2次高市内閣が発足へ
all.description: 先の衆議院選挙を受けた特別国会が18日、召集されます。高市総理大臣は、衆参両院の本会議で第105代の総理大臣に選出される運びで、18日夜、第2次高市内閣が発足する見通しです。

all.headline: 「メモリ」不足でスマホなどの平均価格6％～8％ほど上昇か
all.description: AIの普及を背景に、データの一時保存に使われるパーツ「メモリ」が不足していることから、民間の調査会社は、ことしのスマートフォンやパソコンの平均価格が6％から8％ほど上昇する可能性があると予測しています。

all.headline: 石川 白山 工場地下水からPFOSとPFOA 国指針値1992倍濃度検出
all.description: 東京の化学メーカーは、石川県白山市にある工場の地下水から、有機フッ素化合物「PFAS」のうち、有害性が指摘されている「PFOS」と「PFOA」が、国の指針値の1992倍の濃度で検出されたと明らかにしました。

all.headline: 去年の生鮮野菜の輸入量 前年比20％以上増 天候不順の影響か
all.description: 去年1年間に輸入された生鮮野菜の量は84万トン余りで、前の年より20％以上増えました。天候不順の影響で国産野菜の価格が上昇し、業務用を中心に必要な量を輸入野菜で賄おうという動きが強まったためだとみられます。

all.headline: Trump selects investment projects to be funded by Japan
all.description: The announcement comes one month before Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s planned visit to the White House.

all.headline: Takagi wins milestone 10th Olympic medal as Japan takes bronze in team pursuit
all.description: Takagi is just the second speedskater ever to win double-digit medals on the oval.

all.headline: Trump claims credit for LDP's election victory
all.description: U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi credited his endorsement with the party's success in the election for the lower chamber of parliament.

all.headline: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and U.S. presidential hopeful, dies at 84
all.description: The media-savvy Jesse Jackson advocated ​for the rights of Black Americans and other marginalized communities dating back to the turbulent civil rights movement of the 1960s.

all.headline: Governor says Iwate still faces challenges 15 years after disaster
all.description: Iwate's governor said the prefecture still faces challenges such as "mental health care support, rebuilding people's livelihoods, rising prices and the impact of climate change."

all.headline: As parliament reconvenes, Takaichi faces a balancing act
all.description: The upcoming budget debate is a test of whether the prime minister can balance her promise to work with the opposition with the need to move quickly to get it approved.

all.headline: Defense challenges competence in probation officer murder
all.description: A 36-year-old man admitted to murdering his probation officer, while his defense argued that he is not mentally competent to bear responsibility for the crime.

all.headline: Japan’s inbound tourism booms as outbound travel lags
all.description: Passport ownership remains low at 16.8% of the population, and outbound travel and study have yet to recover to pre-pandemic levels.

all.headline: University of Tsukuba apologizes over comments against foreign students
all.description: Two faculty members posted inflammatory comments on social media about foreign nationals, including describing foreign students as “incompetent” and “troublemakers.”

all.headline: ‘Kokuho’ earns ¥20 billion at Japan box office
all.description: The film now ranks 10th among all-time box office hits in Japan, including Western films and anime.

all.headline: TEPCO’s Niigata Pref. Nuclear Power Plant Begins Transmitting Power to Tokyo Area, 1st Time in 14 Years
all.description: Tokyo Electric Power Company Holdings, Inc. said the No. 6 reactor at its Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power station in Niigata Prefecture has begun transmitting electricity to the Tokyo metropolitan ar

all.headline: U.S. Firm to Build Training Hub in Fukushima N-plant for Debris Removal; Plans to Establish Training Center by 2029
all.description: A U.S. nuclear decommissioning firm plans to establish a training center in Futaba, Fukushima Prefecture, by 2029 to train personnel on the removal of fuel debris at the crippled Fukushima No. 1 nucle

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan Gains Bronze in Speed Skating Women’s Team Pursuit (Update 1)
all.description: Japan gained bronze in speed skating women's team pursuit at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Tuesday, defeating the United States in the race to win bronze medal.

all.headline: AI Agents Should Consult Humans, Say New Rules from Japanese Govt
all.description: With the spread of AI products that handle tasks autonomously, the government plans to ask AI operators to build systems that require decision-making by humans.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Riku Miura, Ryuichi Kihara Clinch Japan’s 1st Gold in Pairs Figure Skating, Rebounding from Disappointing Short Program
all.description: MILAN — Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara on Monday made a stunning comeback from their disappointing short program performance, winning gold in pairs figure skating in Milan. It was Japan’s first Olympic

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kobayashi’s Super Team Medal Bid Meets Sudden End; Heavy Snow Forces Halt to Ski Jump Competition
all.description: Bad weather brought a sudden and disappointing end to the third Olympic appearance of ski jumper Ryoyu Kobayashi, the gold medalist from the previous Games. Japan finished sixth in the men’s super tea

all.headline: Toyota Highlander Reverse Imported from the U.S. to Japan Will Be Official State Vehicle
all.description: A Toyota Highlander SUV manufactured in the United States and reverse imported to Japan was introduced as an official state vehicle by the Economy, Trade and Industry Ministry on Monday.

all.headline: Man Infected with Measles Reportedly Dined at Restaurant in Tokyo Station
all.description: A man in his 30s who was later diagnosed with measles reportedly dined at a restaurant in Tokyo Station on Jan. 31, possibly coming into contact with many commuters and tourists, according to the Toky

all.headline: The Great East Japan Earthquake – Preserving Memories in 3D Images –
all.description: Since March 11, 2011, staff photographers of The Yomiuri Shimbun newspaper have been covering the people and places affected by the Great East Japan Earthquake, from vantage points on the ground and i

all.description: NEW YORK/ WASHINGTON, Feb 16 (Reuters) - A U.S. federal judge in Pennsylvania ordered the National Park Service on Monday to reinstall a slavery exhibit at a Philadelphia historic site, pending the ou

all.headline: Lunar New Year 2026: Celebrations around the world
all.description: Millions of people around the world are celebrating the start of the Lunar New Year, with festivities taking place from Hong Kong to Buenos Aires.

all.headline: Dual nationals face scramble for UK passports as new rules come into force
all.description: Entry requirements to the UK for dual nationals are being overhauled as part of sweeping changes to the immigration system.

all.headline: Ex-winger Utai in serious condition after shooting
all.description: Former NRL star Matt Utai is in a "critical condition" after being shot multiple times outside his home in Sydney, Australia.

all.headline: China is hitting Japan where it hurts. Will PM Takaichi give in?
all.description: From recalling pandas to cancelling tourist flights, China continues to retaliate after Takaichi's comments on Taiwan.

all.headline: 'Dragged out and set on fire' - the Bangladesh mob killing that shocked the world
all.description: In December, Hindu factory worker Dipu Das was lynched in Bangladesh, igniting global outrage.

all.headline: Bondi Beach shooting accused faces court for the first time
all.description: The 24-year-old faces 59 charges, including 15 counts of murder and one of committing a terrorist attack.

all.headline: Sydney police plead for return of man, 85, kidnapped by mistake
all.description: Police say they're 'a million percent confident' Chris Baghsarian was not the intended target.

all.headline: ByteDance to curb AI video app after Disney legal threat
all.description: Videos featuring Spider-Man and other characters which are Disney's intellectual property have gone viral since Seedance's update.

all.headline: British couple held by Taliban describe 'culture shock' returning to UK
all.description: Peter and Barbie Reynolds were released by the Taliban in September after being detained for seven-and-a-half months.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: 80兆円規模の対米投資“第1弾を選定”トランプ大統領が発表
primary.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、17日、SNSへの投稿で、先の日米合意に基づく日本からアメリカへの80兆円規模の投資や融資などをめぐって、石油・ガス事業や重要鉱物事業など3つのプロジェクトを第1弾に選定したと発表しました。

primary.headline: スピードスケート女子パシュート 日本が銅 3大会連続のメダル
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スピードスケートの女子団体パシュートは3位決定戦が行われ、日本はアメリカに勝ち銅メダルを獲得しました。日本はこの種目3大会連続のメダル獲得となりました。また今大会で日本が獲得したメダルが合わせて19個となり、過去最多の前回・北京大会を上回りました。

primary.headline: フィギュア女子SP 初出場・中井亜美がトップ 坂本花織は2位
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートは女子シングル前半のショートプログラムが行われ、初出場の17歳・中井亜美選手が冒頭に大技の「トリプルアクセル」を成功させて自己ベストの78.71をマークしトップに立ちました。またエースの坂本花織選手が77.23で2位で続き、初出場の千葉百音選手が74.00で4位となっています。

primary.headline: 特別国会きょう召集 今夜 第2次高市内閣が発足へ
primary.description: 先の衆議院選挙を受けた特別国会が18日、召集されます。高市総理大臣は、衆参両院の本会議で第105代の総理大臣に選出される運びで、18日夜、第2次高市内閣が発足する見通しです。

primary.headline: 「メモリ」不足でスマホなどの平均価格6％～8％ほど上昇か
primary.description: AIの普及を背景に、データの一時保存に使われるパーツ「メモリ」が不足していることから、民間の調査会社は、ことしのスマートフォンやパソコンの平均価格が6％から8％ほど上昇する可能性があると予測しています。

primary.headline: 石川 白山 工場地下水からPFOSとPFOA 国指針値1992倍濃度検出
primary.description: 東京の化学メーカーは、石川県白山市にある工場の地下水から、有機フッ素化合物「PFAS」のうち、有害性が指摘されている「PFOS」と「PFOA」が、国の指針値の1992倍の濃度で検出されたと明らかにしました。

primary.headline: 去年の生鮮野菜の輸入量 前年比20％以上増 天候不順の影響か
primary.description: 去年1年間に輸入された生鮮野菜の量は84万トン余りで、前の年より20％以上増えました。天候不順の影響で国産野菜の価格が上昇し、業務用を中心に必要な量を輸入野菜で賄おうという動きが強まったためだとみられます。

primary.headline: Trump selects investment projects to be funded by Japan
primary.description: The announcement comes one month before Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s planned visit to the White House.

primary.headline: Takagi wins milestone 10th Olympic medal as Japan takes bronze in team pursuit
primary.description: Takagi is just the second speedskater ever to win double-digit medals on the oval.

primary.headline: Trump claims credit for LDP's election victory
primary.description: U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi credited his endorsement with the party's success in the election for the lower chamber of parliament.

primary.headline: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and U.S. presidential hopeful, dies at 84
primary.description: The media-savvy Jesse Jackson advocated ​for the rights of Black Americans and other marginalized communities dating back to the turbulent civil rights movement of the 1960s.

primary.headline: Governor says Iwate still faces challenges 15 years after disaster
primary.description: Iwate's governor said the prefecture still faces challenges such as "mental health care support, rebuilding people's livelihoods, rising prices and the impact of climate change."

primary.headline: As parliament reconvenes, Takaichi faces a balancing act
primary.description: The upcoming budget debate is a test of whether the prime minister can balance her promise to work with the opposition with the need to move quickly to get it approved.

primary.headline: Defense challenges competence in probation officer murder
primary.description: A 36-year-old man admitted to murdering his probation officer, while his defense argued that he is not mentally competent to bear responsibility for the crime.

primary.headline: Japan’s inbound tourism booms as outbound travel lags
primary.description: Passport ownership remains low at 16.8% of the population, and outbound travel and study have yet to recover to pre-pandemic levels.

primary.headline: University of Tsukuba apologizes over comments against foreign students
primary.description: Two faculty members posted inflammatory comments on social media about foreign nationals, including describing foreign students as “incompetent” and “troublemakers.”

primary.headline: ‘Kokuho’ earns ¥20 billion at Japan box office
primary.description: The film now ranks 10th among all-time box office hits in Japan, including Western films and anime.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan Gains Bronze in Speed Skating Women’s Team Pursuit (Update 1)
primary.description: Japan gained bronze in speed skating women's team pursuit at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Tuesday, defeating the United States in the race to win bronze medal.

primary.headline: AI Agents Should Consult Humans, Say New Rules from Japanese Govt
primary.description: With the spread of AI products that handle tasks autonomously, the government plans to ask AI operators to build systems that require decision-making by humans.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Riku Miura, Ryuichi Kihara Clinch Japan’s 1st Gold in Pairs Figure Skating, Rebounding from Disappointing Short Program
primary.description: MILAN — Riku Miura and Ryuichi Kihara on Monday made a stunning comeback from their disappointing short program performance, winning gold in pairs figure skating in Milan. It was Japan’s first Olympic

primary.headline: Toyota Highlander Reverse Imported from the U.S. to Japan Will Be Official State Vehicle
primary.description: A Toyota Highlander SUV manufactured in the United States and reverse imported to Japan was introduced as an official state vehicle by the Economy, Trade and Industry Ministry on Monday.

primary.headline: Man Infected with Measles Reportedly Dined at Restaurant in Tokyo Station
primary.description: A man in his 30s who was later diagnosed with measles reportedly dined at a restaurant in Tokyo Station on Jan. 31, possibly coming into contact with many commuters and tourists, according to the Toky

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
Congratulations to the figure skating pair Riki Miura and Ryuichi Kihara for winning the gold medal at the Milan-Cortina Olympics!

The two, affectionately known as ``Rikuryu'', showed an incredible comeback, bouncing back from adversity with perfect performance and breaking the record for the highest score in the free skate.
We welcomed everyone involved in Ibaraki Prefecture's "Mt. Tsukuba Plum Festival," "Tsuchiura Lotus Roots," and "Koga Peach Festival" to the Prime Minister's Office.

Congratulations to Yukima Horishima, the men's freestyle skiing dual mogul, who won the first silver medal in men's moguls in Japan at the Milan-Cortina Olympics, and Miho Takagi, the women's speed skater, who won her second bronze medal in the 500m speed skating event!

We are very grateful to have received the beautiful red and white plum blossoms from everyone at Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine, including Chief Priest Nishitakatsuji.
Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine is famous for the god of learning, Michizane Sugawara.
We are currently in the midst of exam season, and I pray that all examinees across the country will demonstrate their full potential.

Today, members of the Liaison Committee for Families of Victims Abducted by North Korea and the National Council for the Rescue of Japanese Abducted by North Korea came to the Prime Minister's Office to receive the ``Future Campaign Policy'' that was decided yesterday.
